page.title: 18Johnstone: New Houses
page.content: Between the railway station and Overton Road, 112 houses are presently being built by Wimpey. These are timber framed houses and, once the foundations are laid each house is erected in about four hours. The roof is assembled on the ground and then a crane lifts and holds this structure while the walls are put in. Each house is double glazed and fully insulated because the houses are on a direct flightpath to Glasgow Airport and adjacent to the railway line. We spoke to the site agent who was from Ireland. He supervises the workmen and makes sure that everything proceeds efficiently. At the end of the work he moves to somewhere else in the country.
